conclusion: Determine the work done by the gas from state B to state C using ideal gas properties.
Temperature at state C is T_0 because internal energy is conserved and U = aT.
Process from state B to C is a horizontal line indicating constant pressure (isobaric process).
For an isobaric process, work done is W = -p ΔV.
Pressure at state B is 0.6p_0, pressure at state C is 0.6p_0, volume at state B is V_0, volume at state C is 0.5V_0.
Work done by the gas is W = 0.3p_0 V_0.
